answers.answer: I have not experience something like this but I do wish you the best of lucks on this one.Do try to rest as much as possible.Regards,
I had this with my first son from 6-15 weeks, went on complete bedrest and progesterone and it resolved, went on to have a beautiful healthy son whos now 8.  Good luck
I had this at week 11 and bleed for a week. After a week with my feet up all went back to normal. At 32 weeks now. Good luck

hi, I had the same thing while pregnant with my twins last year. I had bleeding about every weekend I even passed a few clots...it was very scary..however, my twin girls are now 9 months old, healthy and thriving. I was put on strict bed rest for the first few months and again during the last month or two. I delivered early due to one of the placentas becoming weak (possibly an aftermath of the subchrorionic hematoma and gestational diabetes)...just relax and REST REST REST!!!...God bless!!!

Hi,thanks for your comments.I am hoping that the next U/s next week shows that everything is settling down.  I really cannot do bedrest for now due to work commitments, and my 2 yo is sick.  But I am trying to take things easy!I also have diabetes and am on insulin.  But currently blood sugars are very well controlled.

question: Well I was having spotting adn cramping last night.  I thought I was about 7 weeks tomorrow.  Contacted my obe and she asked me to do U/s today to check.Found a 5 week 6 day embryo with 115 heart rate.  Good!But also found subchorionic bleeding about 0.4 cubic cm.So my obe has started me on progesterone injection every 3 days (Ouch)!  The clinic did the first one, but I have to do the next ones.  And crinone every night for 2 weeks, after which we repeat the u/s and see if baby is progressing / the bleed is resolving.  Plus supposed to bed rest, which i truely can't, but will  try to rest a bit more...Anyone have this and things turned out ok?Added on top my 2 YO is sick and not able to sleep much with her waking and coughing so much.
title: Subchorionic Hemorrage
